info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 7:08PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF UPPER TREASURE VALLEY... WESTERN MAGIC VALLEY...BOISE MOUNTAINS...AND CAMAS PRAIRIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 707 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 7 miles east of Boise Stage Stop to 8 miles southeast of Twentymile Butte and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Glenns Ferry, Twentymile Butte, Deadman Flat and King Hill around 710 PM MST. Hagerman, Bliss and White Arrow Hot Spring around 720 PM MST. Gooding and Wendell around 740 PM MST. Jerome, Little Camas Reservoir, Cat Creek Summit and Blair Trail Reservoir around 750 PM MST. Anderson Ranch Reservoir and Deer Heaven Mountain around 800 PM MST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
